GOD.content: contamination btwn: 1) renouncing oneself, denying the gift, as the generosity of the gift that must withdraw itself (se retirer), se cacher, sacrifice itself in order to give 2) repression that transforms gift into economy of sacrifice
GOD.linkedContent: contamination btwn: 1) renouncing oneself, denying the gift, as the generosity of the gift that must withdraw itself (se retirer), se cacher, sacrifice itself in order to give 2) repression that transforms gift into economy of sacrifice

GOD.content: a heterogenous trembling that apprehends, gives oneself death in a new way
GOD.linkedContent: a heterogenous trembling that apprehends, gives oneself death in a new way

GOD.content: plea for forgiveness in inheritance of God’s retraction; God’s retraction, a double coming-back, covenant only sealed through repetition [Noah is twice forgiven], God goes back on himself; dissymmetrical contract of Covenant supposes double trait of this retreat (re-trait) (Entzug)
GOD.linkedContent: plea for forgiveness in inheritance of God’s retraction; God’s retraction, a double coming-back, covenant only sealed through repetition [Noah is twice forgiven], God goes back on himself; dissymmetrical contract of Covenant supposes double trait of this retreat (re-trait) (Entzug)

POOF.content: via Heidegger, philía as opening, accord, in essential relation w/ phúsis as covering up, dissimulation of self > phúsis qua philía: l’une, comme l’autre, garde ce rapport à la fois généreux et jaloux à elle-même—elle aime à se cacher, krúptesthai phileîn > le retrait de la pudeur [decency] donne ici le mouvement même: gives the gift (donne le don), accords phúsis and philía
POOF.linkedContent: via Heidegger, philía as opening, accord, in essential relation w/ phúsis as covering up, dissimulation of self > phúsis qua philía: l’une, comme l’autre, garde ce rapport à la fois généreux et jaloux à elle-même—elle aime à se cacher, krúptesthai phileîn > le retrait de la pudeur [decency] donne ici le mouvement même: gives the gift (donne le don), accords phúsis and philía

PP.content: disappearance, retrait of father’s face (good-sun-capital) is movement of differance, which opens to writing, which writing opens for itself, threatens hierarchical interiority of pharmacy
PP.linkedContent: disappearance, retrait of father’s face (good-sun-capital) is movement of differance, which opens to writing, which writing opens for itself, threatens hierarchical interiority of pharmacy

S.content: from masculine spirit (that chases and hunts) to feminine soul (that guards and nourishes), the trait, re-trait (Riss from fire-writing), engraves sadness in spirit’s relation to itself, soul bears the sadness
S.linkedContent: from masculine spirit (that chases and hunts) to feminine soul (that guards and nourishes), the trait, re-trait (Riss from fire-writing), engraves sadness in spirit’s relation to itself, soul bears the sadness

S.content: wouldn’t Jews, Moslem, Christians respond to Heidegger’s retrait, flame and fire-writing in promise? [messianic echoes]
S.linkedContent: wouldn’t Jews, Moslem, Christians respond to Heidegger’s retrait, flame and fire-writing in promise? [messianic echoes]

SH.content: date not there, w/ draws in order to appear, there are dates (just like there are ashes), even if they don’t exist
SH.linkedContent: date not there, w/ draws in order to appear, there are dates (just like there are ashes), even if they don’t exist

SP.content: for Heidegger, forgetting of a being incommensurable w/ forgetting of Being: [Derrida quotes Heidegger: can’t understand forgetting as a human fact, as omission, Being not umbrella of distracted philosopher, forgetting attacks essence of Being, is the Destiny of the essence of Being]
SP.linkedContent: for Heidegger, forgetting of a being incommensurable w/ forgetting of Being: [Derrida quotes Heidegger: can’t understand forgetting as a human fact, as omission, Being not umbrella of distracted philosopher, forgetting attacks essence of Being, is the Destiny of the essence of Being]

RM.content: Verhüllung (veiling), Verborgenheit (being-hidden), Being withholds (se retient), withdraws (se retire) (sich entzieht), retrait
RM.linkedContent: Verhüllung (veiling), Verborgenheit (being-hidden), Being withholds (se retient), withdraws (se retire) (sich entzieht), retrait

RM.content: quasi-metaphor of Being, since it is nothing, since its as obliterates its as such
RM.linkedContent: quasi-metaphor of Being, since it is nothing, since its as obliterates its as such

RM.content: metaphysics as tropics, corresponds to an essential withdrawal of Being > Being, the metaphor of metaphor (quasi-metaphor), overload of a supplementary trait, fold: re-trait
RM.linkedContent: metaphysics as tropics, corresponds to an essential withdrawal of Being > Being, the metaphor of metaphor (quasi-metaphor), overload of a supplementary trait, fold: re-trait

RM.content: metaphysics can only be exceeded, withdrawal of Being, if metaphor withdraws—insofar as metaphor is a metaphysical concept > finding no proper
RM.linkedContent: metaphysics can only be exceeded, withdrawal of Being, if metaphor withdraws—insofar as metaphor is a metaphysical concept > finding no proper

RM.content: withdrawal of Being donne lieu to metaphysics, ontotheology, producing concept of metaphor, producing/calling itself in a quasi-metaphorical manner
RM.linkedContent: withdrawal of Being donne lieu to metaphysics, ontotheology, producing concept of metaphor, producing/calling itself in a quasi-metaphorical manner

RM.content: not opposed to metaphor but will limitlessly extend/load (chargera) any metaphoric trait w/ supplementary surplus value; re-trait (at once +/–), double movement of being
RM.linkedContent: not opposed to metaphor but will limitlessly extend/load (chargera) any metaphoric trait w/ supplementary surplus value; re-trait (at once +/–), double movement of being

RM.content: word re-trait designates quasi-catachrestic violence, abuse I impose on language, hopefully justified by necessity of good, economic formalization
RM.linkedContent: word re-trait designates quasi-catachrestic violence, abuse I impose on language, hopefully justified by necessity of good, economic formalization

RM.content: unlike metaphors that give us access to the unknown, “withdrawal of Being” gives us to think less Being or metaphor than the Being or the metaphor of the withdrawal—gives us to think more about the the way, the vehicle, the making-way
RM.linkedContent: unlike metaphors that give us access to the unknown, “withdrawal of Being” gives us to think less Being or metaphor than the Being or the metaphor of the withdrawal—gives us to think more about the the way, the vehicle, the making-way

RM.content: Being, which is nothing: makes possible metaphoricity & its withdrawal
RM.linkedContent: Being, which is nothing: makes possible metaphoricity & its withdrawal

RM.content: no proper term in this écart sans écart
RM.linkedContent: no proper term in this écart sans écart

RM.content: to state condition of metaphoricity nonliterally: withdrawal by which what is distanced (entfernt) in the non-near of proximity is withdrawn & sheltered
RM.linkedContent: to state condition of metaphoricity nonliterally: withdrawal by which what is distanced (entfernt) in the non-near of proximity is withdrawn & sheltered

RM.content: plus de métalanguage > toujours une métaphore de plus au moment où la métaphore se retire (in opening out [évasant] its limits)
RM.linkedContent: plus de métalanguage > toujours une métaphore de plus au moment où la métaphore se retire (in opening out [évasant] its limits)

RM.content: isn’t there a metaphor of withdrawal that authorizes one to speak of ontological difference and withdrawal of metaphor?
RM.linkedContent: isn’t there a metaphor of withdrawal that authorizes one to speak of ontological difference and withdrawal of metaphor?

RM.content: metaphysical unity of opposition determined only “starting from (à partir de)” the re-trait of the trait > the “starting from” s’y abîme lui-même
RM.linkedContent: metaphysical unity of opposition determined only “starting from (à partir de)” the re-trait of the trait > the “starting from” s’y abîme lui-même

RM.content: Being’s inscription n’arrive qu’à s’effacer, cf. differance/trace
RM.linkedContent: Being’s inscription n’arrive qu’à s’effacer, cf. differance/trace

LI.content: the confrontation btwn Austin & Derrida confirmed and developed in Sarl’s process of withdrawing it
LI.linkedContent: the confrontation btwn Austin & Derrida confirmed and developed in Sarl’s process of withdrawing it

TN.content: [Nancy’s] garder: points to truth’s verity (veritas, Wahrheit), and economy; is garder compatible w/ retrait (withdrawal), w/ retenue (holding back, retaining)
TN.linkedContent: [Nancy’s] garder: points to truth’s verity (veritas, Wahrheit), and economy; is garder compatible w/ retrait (withdrawal), w/ retenue (holding back, retaining)

TN.content: for Nancy, offering in the gift is the “withdrawal of the gift,” of its being-present
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, offering in the gift is the “withdrawal of the gift,” of its being-present

TN.content: cela se touche: “it itself touches itself,” “one touches it, it lets itself be touched” > imagination: possibility auto-affecting its essence of a nonessence: it is touched, in a movement de retrait ou de re-pli, becomes at moment it touches untouchable [re: imagination “touching” sublime]
TN.linkedContent: cela se touche: “it itself touches itself,” “one touches it, it lets itself be touched” > imagination: possibility auto-affecting its essence of a nonessence: it is touched, in a movement de retrait ou de re-pli, becomes at moment it touches untouchable [re: imagination “touching” sublime]

ATM.content: acc. Levinas, man, monotheistic man, has a unique relation to the ab-solute retrait of the revealed Name
ATM.linkedContent: acc. Levinas, man, monotheistic man, has a unique relation to the ab-solute retrait of the revealed Name

AD.content: discretion: manifestation & withdrawal in the face [the woman?]
trace of withdrawal, of face, visitation, unforeseeable, messianic visit, the “passing (passée)” of guest > dislocates temporal presence and representation, exceeds anamnestic representation
AD.linkedContent: trace of withdrawal, of face, visitation, unforeseeable, messianic visit, the “passing (passée)” of guest > dislocates temporal presence and representation, exceeds anamnestic representation

CIN.content: essence of cinder (its cinder itself): the insistent pharmakon of a plural body (doesn’t belong to itself) in which the retreat of fire disguises itself > if there is cinder, fire remains in retreat
CIN.linkedContent: essence of cinder (its cinder itself): the insistent pharmakon of a plural body (doesn’t belong to itself) in which the retreat of fire disguises itself > if there is cinder, fire remains in retreat

CIN.content: Derrida’s not accumulating surplus value, speculating on some cinder capital, but making a withdrawal (retrait), to try his luck on a gift w/out the least memory of itself, un retrait (retreat, retracing) w/ no relation to what he just did, what he’s about to tell you
CIN.linkedContent: Derrida’s not accumulating surplus value, speculating on some cinder capital, but making a withdrawal (retrait), to try his luck on a gift w/out the least memory of itself, un retrait (retreat, retracing) w/ no relation to what he just did, what he’s about to tell you

BSi.content: unheimlich: 1) worrying aspect of foreignness as intimacy of one’s own home 2) says the essential bearing of Celan’s “Meridian” 3) associated w/ the foreigner 4) Geheimnis (the intimate, the folded back on itself, what has withdrawn in withdrawal, hidden inside of house and home), secret of encounter at most intimate heart of present
BSi.linkedContent: unheimlich: 1) worrying aspect of foreignness as intimacy of one’s own home 2) says the essential bearing of Celan’s “Meridian” 3) associated w/ the foreigner 4) Geheimnis (the intimate, the folded back on itself, what has withdrawn in withdrawal, hidden inside of house and home), secret of encounter at most intimate heart of present
